pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [9c64135002](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16964/commits/9c64135002a0ef0fd3bb0dedd0a4502a2923a5c6)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsInitial`
`+ IsInitial.card_le_card`
`+ IsInitial.card_lt_card`
`+ IsInitial.ord_card`
`+ isInitialIso`
`+ isInitial_natCast`
`+ isInitial_omega0`
`+ isInitial_one`
`+ isInitial_ord`
`+ isInitial_zero`
`+ not_bddAbove_isInitial`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
I'll move these results once #16990 goes through.

:v: vihdzp can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11364358903/job/31610225285)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11364358903/job/31610225572)
bors d+
Looks good!
bors d+
Is there no part of this file which could be split to a different one?

I can see three such things. 
- That weird lemma on lists has no reason to be here (and I deprecate it in #16966). 
- `Cardinal.univ` also shouldn't be defined here (and it should be defined as `#Cardinal` instead). 
- Finally, addition and successors should be moved to `Arithmetic` (which will also be a few hundred lines shorter once I deprecate stuff like `bsup`, `lsub`, etc.). 

All of these will take a bit of time, though.
Of course, the simpler alternative is to move the stuff about initial ordinals to `Cardinal/Ordinal`. But that file is very close to the 1.5k limit itself, so it'd be trading one thing for the other.
What about the 200 lines porting note at the end of `Cardinal/Ordinal`? Regardless we should add a file for more advanced cardinal stuff soon, as `Cardinal/Basic` is bloated as well.

Yeah, that porting note should be removed. 

There's a lot of splitting potential across these files. Another idea I've had is splitting `Cardinal/Ordinal` into `Cardinal/Aleph` and `Cardinal/Arithmetic`. Then this initial ordinal stuff could go in the former. Or `Ordinal/Arithmetic` into `Ordinal/Arithmetic` and `Ordinal/Order`.
Actually, I've made the first of these splits in #16990. I'll move this definition to the `Aleph` file if the refactor goes through.
make `iff`
This should hold without `hb`.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(SetTheory/Cardinal/Aleph): define initial ordinals
